What is the purpose of the OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY flag in Verus?

The OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY flag, which has a value of 64, is used to restrict a PBaaS chain or gateway to a single currency. This option can be used to limit the currencies that can be used on a particular chain or gateway.

oken, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
./raw_text_input_wiki/release_notes.md
What does the OPTION_GATEWAY flag do in Verus?

The OPTION_GATEWAY flag, which has a value of 128, is used to indicate that a chain or gateway routes external currencies. This means that the chain or gateway is capable of handling and processing external currencies.

oken, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition

OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```

What is the significance of the OPTION_PBAAS flag in Verus?

The OPTION_PBAAS flag, which has a value of 256, is used to indicate that a chain definition is a PBaaS (Public Blockchain as a Service) chain. This flag is used to define the properties and behavior of a PBaaS chain.

oken, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```

What does the OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER flag do in Verus?

The OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER flag, which has a value of 512, is used to indicate that a specific PBaaS gateway is the default converter and will publish prices. This means that the gateway is responsible for converting between different currencies and publishing the conversion rates.

oken, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency

OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```

What is the purpose of the OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag in Verus?

The OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag, which has a value of 1024, is used to control top-level ID and currency registration on a gateway. When this flag is not set, registration happens on the launch chain instead.

oken, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
./raw_text_input_wiki/release_notes.md
What does the OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag do in Verus?

The OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag, which has a value of 2048, is used to create a single satoshi NFT (Non-Fungible Token) token, which tokenizes control over the root ID. This means that the token represents ownership and control over a unique digital asset.

oken, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
